result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul C Negron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO THIS CASE:  Supply DNA sample.  Pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  25% of prison funds collected by DOC to go toward all monetary obligations.
***Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by DOC, probation and parole. All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.

****ORDER dated 09-25-2014/Judge Witkowiak; time served credit is a TOTAL of 20 days applying to Counts 1 & 3.****
Concurrent with: Concurrent to current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.  No possession/consumption/selling/distribution/being in the vicinity of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with victim James T. and with Caption Andre W.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: COUNTS TWO AND THREE:  AS ORDERED IN COUNT ONE.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Sentence may be served at Wisconsin State Prison.  ORDER amending dated January 13, 2015  (Ct. 3 is concurrent with Ct. 2 )

***ORDER AMENDING JOC, dated January 13, 2015/Judge Timothy Witkowiak/Count three is CONCURRENT with count two and CONSECUTIVE to count one.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.  May be served at Wisconsin State Prison.***CORRECTION...09-25-2014/Judge Timothy Witkowiak:  Count 3 shall be amended to state it is CONCURRENT with Count 1.  ORDER also amends time served credit as total of 20 days.***  ***ORDER AMENDING JOC, dated January 13, 2015/Judge Timothy Witkowiak/Count three is CONCURRENT with count two and CONSECUTIVE to count one. (remove 20 day credit)

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharge, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharge. (Paul Negron #276050, WRC, P.O. Box 220, Winnebago, WI  54985).

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court, defendant Paul C Negron not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant complained of back spasms and would not come out of his jail cell.  Br. 19 staff proceeded to the Milwaukee County Jail to conduct hearing.  Defendant appears via jail cell.  Court adopts the findings of Judge Williams in Ozaukee County case number 17CF191 and finds defendant competent.   Email sent to Administrative Law Judge Mayumi Ishii at DHAMail@wisconsin.gov attaching copy of Dr. Engen's report.  No further action need on this case.

Defendant Paul C Negron in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Paul C Negron in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  State does not contest the findings of Dr. Engen.  Defendant is challenging the report.  Court sets matter for a Contested Competency Hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 22, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court, defendant Paul C Negron not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Attorney needs to go over report with the defendant, who is currently housed at Columbia Correctional.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 17, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
From Dr. Engen dated July 25, 2018
For Competency Examination

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court, defendant Paul C Negron not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for a competency determination pending revocation.   Forensic Unit to conduct evaluation.  Matter adjourned for Doctor's Report Return.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric m Hailstock via telephone; unable to appear due to family emergency, defendant Paul C Negron not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Pickett for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for Status of Counsel and Appointment of Doctor.  As Attorney Hailstock is unable to appear today, matter adjourned to June 20, 2018 at which time Court will appoint a doctor to conduct evaluation.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Video technician is unavailable for the currently scheduled date of June 15, 2018 for Status of Counsel and Appointment of Doctor.  Defendant will not be appearing via video.

Email sent to Public Defenders Office requesting counsel be appointed for defendant; email sent to video technician requesting defendant appear via video from Dodge when this matter is scheduled for status of counsel and appointment of doctor to conduct competency evaluation
Request for competency determination from the Division of Hearings and Appeals.  Forwarded to Branch 19, Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, to set status date.  jbs

Defendant Paul C Negron in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Paul C Negron in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1,2, and 3,Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  


Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense. 
.
AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to Current Sentence, and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to Current Sentence, with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE. Sentence may be served at Wisconsin State Prison.  Credit for 0 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 2.  Sentence may be served at Wisconsin State Prison. Credit for 0 days time served. 
.
CONDITIONS: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-no possession/consumption/selling/distribution/being in the vicinity of illegal drugs/alcohol;
-random urine screens, if deemed appropriate;
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation;
-no contact with victim, James T, and with Captain Andre W;
-pay restitution in the amount of $ZERO;
-supply DNA sample;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-25% of prison funds, collected by Department of Corrections, to go toward all monetary obligations;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-
-  Driver's License SUSPENDED for a period of 6 MONTHS (COUNT 2).
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Firearm/Voting Rights/Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  
-
Credit given for 78 days time served (COUNT 1).
Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program (COUNT 1).
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant.

Attorney Avery L. Goodrich in court, defendant Paul C Negron not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul C Negron in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Defendant Paul C Negron in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nat Tharpe-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or BURGLARIOUS TOOLS.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Paul C Negron in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Paul C Negron in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
